title: [Large-Scale] Practical Applications of Transfer Learning and Data Augmentation for Medical Image Classification

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Python programming and foundational deep learning concepts
context.additional_context: Practice-centered training to develop competencies in image processing techniques and classification model design reflecting medical data characteristics

learning_goals: Learners can implement a transfer learning-based medical image classification model using ResNet50 and VGG-16 within 6 months, achieve ≥85% Top-1 accuracy on public medical image datasets (e.g., CheXpert, MIMIC-CXR), and submit a performance comparison analysis report.

Learners can apply data augmentation techniques (rotation, resizing, brightness adjustment) and preprocessing (noise removal, contrast enhancement, Canny edge detection) to small image datasets (<1,000 images) within 6 months, improve model accuracy by ≥15%, and submit experimental results as a report.

Learners can implement a hybrid model combining SVM classifiers with LSTM/Transformer-based deep learning models on 5 public datasets, achieve ≥85% average accuracy via 5-fold cross-validation, and demonstrate ≥5% performance improvement over single models through hyperparameter tuning.

Learners can calculate performance metrics (accuracy, sensitivity, AUC) for a medical image classification model (based on lung cancer CT image datasets), explain ≥3 clinical implications of each metric, and propose 2 model improvement strategies based on analysis.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
